title: Why do people reroll OP URF champions?
body: Seriously I had people reroll {{champion:114}} {{champion:35}} {{champion:37}} {{champion:8}} today. Without even giving them away to someone else who wants to play them.

replies.body: I hate when people don't ask before rerolling, but to answer your question, people play the game mode _for fun_. I find sona, garen, teemo, and a lot of other "op" urf champions incredibly boring to play and would rather play someone more enjoyable, even if they're arguably not as good.
I reroll people like vlad because i suck with him. I ask if anyone wants him, then after 10 seconds i reroll and get yelled at lol.
It's ARAM all over again. Honestly I blame Riot for not implementing a system that puts rerolled champions automatically on a "up for grabs" pool or something.
Another reason people reroll is maybe they don't own the champs teammates got. Also maybe they didn't think to ask. It could also be they just wanted to play a different champion.
